description:
Now in the early 80s Michael Bloomberg had an unlikely proposal to investment banks worldwide "Buy an expensive terminal from me that you need to find room for beside your computer at your desk." A tough sale you might have thought but banks and traders had lapped them up. And if you walk through them today in these rooms you'll see that they're now indispensable so much so that the fact that every single one of them around the world today failed for several hours, caused big problems not just for bankers. The UK government postponed borrowing £3 billion today because of this. Our market guest today is Justin Urquart Stewart from Seven Investment Management. Justin, how important are these terminals, for example, in your investment firm?

Oh, very important indeed. I mean a few years ago, these were just terminals which gave you information and we had other alternatives like Reuters and things like that. But then it became batchy part of the trading process. So you didn't actually have to telephone and a lot of it just went straight through the Bloomberg. So as soon as the Bloomberg stops, it's not just a matter of price information - all that information is gone - but then sinew abilities to transact immediately. But then of course we had another problem this morning. As soon as it all went down, you say, well, we'll back up, we'll go straight to the telephone. Good. Who's got the telephone numbers? They're in the Bloomberg. So you then have to say, well, hang on, someone's got a piece of paper somewhere with the telephone numbers on. Now luckily we also have traders from the old school. Vice chief dealer Saatchi joined me originally back in 1987. So we do know how to press button B and actually work a telephone.

话题：

Writing: imagine a scenario or express your opinion
Automatic
Automatic means something happens by itself, without needing direct action. What is automatic? Why is it automatic?
This week's topic: They took automatic actions... (90-110 words)

Suggestions:
1) automatic door
2) automatic transmission
3) automatic response
4) automatic temperature control
5) Instead of writing a scenario, feel free to comment on the story below.

范例1：

The building where Shawn worked went into automatic lock-down at twelve midnight, but the area could be accessed by employees with a high enough security clearance on their key card. As the team leader of a department, Shawn had a security clearance level which would grant him access to the facility twenty-four seven. Often, if the work was piling up or if there were pressing deadlines, Shawn would even stay the night in his office to minimize the commute time. As a result, he was familiar with the operation schedule of the building.
